note.p: Education: King's College London; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1856), MA (1859)

Career: Called to the Bar at Lincoln's Inn (1858); Lecturer in Mathematics, Queen's College, Cambridge; Inspector of Schools, Lower Provinces Bengal, Bengal Education Department (1865); placed on special duty to assist Joseph Hooker (FRS 1847) in preparing the 'Flora of British India' (1877); returned to India (1883); retired (1887); volunteer work, Kew Gardens; Joseph Hooker named the genus Clarkella after him; died after a short illness
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1907 vol 79 pp xlix-lvi signed by D P
